instructions.display_text: In a large bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, hot sauce, 2 teaspoons of smokehouse maple seasoning, the onion powder, garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of salt, and ½ teaspoon of pepper.
Add the drumsticks to the marinade and turn to coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or up to 24 hours.
Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and set a wire rack on top.
In a separate large bowl, whisk together the panko, crushed corn flakes, remaining tablespoon of smokehouse maple seasoning, remaining teaspoon of salt, and remaining ½ teaspoon of pepper.

Remove the chicken from the marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Add the drumsticks to the panko mixture and turn until well coated, pressing the breading into the chicken. Set the chicken on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 50 minutes, turning halfway, until golden brown and crispy and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C).
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons McCormick® Smokehouse Maple Seasoning, divided

compilations.name: Cereal Recipes Which Aren't Breakfast
compilations.description: Who doesn't love cereal? Yes, it's the perfect breakfast, especially when paired with those loony cartoons, but as you grow up, you realize, you can eat cereal any time! For a toasty snack, test out our Jalapeno Taco Poppers and to calm your tastebuds down, try some Rainbow Cereal Cheesecake. Don't forget to tell us which way your tastebuds take you!

Cereal for dinner isn't unheard of (we welcome it)! But we have a whole day's worth of cereal recipes that are gourmet too. Our smoky, over-fried chicken is coated with cereal crumbs for a whole new layer of flavor and makes for a great dinner. And did you know you can make some smashing crunchy jalapeño poppers with cereal? Retrieve those long-forgotten cereal boxes, it's chef-fing time!
compilations.name: Eat Cereal Foods For A Whole Day

results.keywords: baked golden brown , crunchy panko and cornflakes mix, drumsticks marinated in buttermilk brine, easy chicken recipes, healthier fried chicken, smoky oven fried chicken, tasty
results.description: Love fried chicken, but not wild about deep frying? Try baking it instead! These drumsticks are marinated in a flavor-packed buttermilk brine, then dredged in a crunchy mix of panko and cornflakes. After it’s baked to golden brown perfection, serve it with your favorite sides.
results.name: Smoky Oven-Fried Chicken

instructions.display_text: Line an 8x8-inch (20 x 20-cm) baking dish with parchment paper.

In a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, chicken, hot sauce, cheeses, and ranch dressing mix with a fork until smooth and evenly mixed. Transfer to the prepared baking dish and smooth it with a spatula so that it’s spread evenly in the dish. Freeze until solid, at least 1 hour.
Working quickly, remove the solid mixture from the sheet and cut into 4x1-inch (10x3-cm) rectangles. (There should be 16 total.)
Bread each stick by coating in flour, then dredging in egg, and then dipping in bread crumbs. Dip once more in the egg, then once more in the bread crumbs, and transfer to a baking dish.
Heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 375˚F (190˚C).
Carefully lower 3 or 4 of the coated sticks into the oil and fry for about 30 seconds, until golden brown. Continue this until all of the sticks are fried.
Serve warm with ranch.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: We've come back with our all-time favorite melt-in-your-mouth Mozzarella Stick recipes! These are super quick and easy to make and trust us when we say, they are almost too good to be true! Take your pick from quick a Spinach Dip Mozzarella Stick or an elaborate Instagram ready Croquette Mozzarella Sticks. Cook now and thank us later!
compilations.name: Mozzarella Stick Recipes

compilations.description: Chicken is one of our favorite meats to cook with because of its versatility, so we're bringing you our best chicken hits! The Buffalo Mozzarella Sticks are great to cook up for movie night, while our Baked Garlic Parmesan Chicken Wings are great for those looking for some great flavor. And well, it goes without saying that our Chicken Parm Bites are simply magical. What are you waiting for? Dig in!
compilations.name: 6 Chicken Recipes You Can't Resist

compilations.description: We LOVE cheese (who doesn't?) and we know you do too, so we've rounded up some recipes that'll celebrate that cheese adoration. Use your Hot Cheetos and make yourself a delicious Hot Cheeto Burrito, oozing with cheese. Stuff the cheese in some mashed potatoes, fry it, and watch the lovely pull you'll get, or go the classic route and add a lot of it to your mac and cheese. The possibilities are endless and dang, are they cheesi-licious.
compilations.name: Cheesy Recipes You Just Need

compilations.description: Ever wondered why Jerry could not keep his hands off the cheese? Cheese is not only "Tasty" but tis' loved by all. Balance your sweet side with something savoury by trying out these cheesy recipes.. and see for yourself why Jerry kept coming back for more.  SAY YES TO CHEESE!
compilations.name: Cheese the Pain Away

results.keywords: appetizers, buffalo, buffalo chicken, buffalo chicken dip, buffalo chicken mozzarella sticks, fried food, game day, hot wings, mozzarella sticks, party food
results.name: Buffalo Chicken Mozzarella Sticks

instructions.display_text: Carefully slice the pack of dinner rolls in half, being sure to keep the rolls connected as a single units as they are split into tops and bottoms.
Remove the top and place the bottom section in a 9x12 inch (23x30 cm) baking dish.

Sprinkle the bottom with about 1 cup (100 g) of the shredded mozzarella cheese (make sure it is evenly coated as this will act as a barrier between the sauce and the bread, preventing the rolls from getting soggy).
Top the cheese with the shredded rotisserie chicken. Drizzle the hot sauce and ranch dressing evenly over the chicken and spread out evenly with a spoon. Top with remaining mozzarella cheese.
Place the top half of the rolls on top and brush evenly with melted butter.
Bake in a preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until the cheese is melty and the rolls have heated through.
Remove from oven, cool slightly before transferring to a cutting board.
Using a large knife, follow the lines of the rolls, cutting them into 12 individual sliders.
Enjoy!

Easy And Delicious Spicy Appetizers Recipe

compilations.description: Turn up the heat with these extremely spicy dishes. Test your tongue with a cheesy and spicy Hot Cheetos Burrito. Fancy some Asian flavors? Pull out your wok for a chili-loaded Schechuan Chicken. You might want to keep a glass of milk handy!

Chicken is always a crowd favorite, but we you gotta switch it up! Say goodbye to your plain Jane chicken recipes and taste test our carefully picked recipes. If you are a guac fiend like we are, you will absolutely devour the Bacon Guacamole Chicken Bombs and if you're going the fancy route, the Buffalo Chicken Dip is a must-have! Don't forget to pick your favorites!

Chicken Recipes To Cure Your Hunger

compilations.name: Snacks for March Madness
compilations.description: March is here and that means so is a season of magnificent basketball! It’s time to get your brackets straight and cheer your heart out for your time. From Cheesy Chicken Nuggets to Fish & Chips, we are making sure that you get the perfect fuel for this action-packed season. Turn the game on, sit back on your couch and get yourself one of our tasty snacks!

compilations.name: Drool-Worthy Onion Rings And Dips For Your Next Party

compilations.description: Who doesn't love a nice, crispy onion ring? But did you know you could make a classic more exciting? Stuff it with mac and cheese or turn it into a cone and stuff it with meatballs to turn it into a whole meal! These buffalo chicken stuffed rings will make a great game day appetizer. And it is a universal rule the bacon added to any fried dish just makes it that much better! If you like it put a ring on it, already!
compilations.name: These Onion Ring Recipes Are Anything But Basic

results.keywords: app, apps, bleu, blue cheese, buffalo, buzzfeed, chicken, cook, cooking, cream cheese, doughnut, dressing, egg, flour, food, fried, fry, onion, panko, party, ranch dressing, ranch mix, recipe, rings, snacks, tasty, yum

instructions.display_text: In a bowl, combine the cream cheese, buffalo sauce, chicken, cheddar, and ranch. Mix with a fork until smooth and evenly mixed.
Cut each end of the onion, peel of the papery onion skin, and cut the onion on its side into large rings.
Separate the large slices into its separate layers.
Put the rings on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray. Take the chicken mixture and press a small amount against the inside of the onion creating a ring shape of the mixture with a hole in the middle.
Freeze until solid. Usually 3-4 hours.
Heat a pot of oil to 375˚F (190˚C).
Set up a breading station by placing flour, beaten eggs, and panko bread crumbs into separate bowls.
Working quickly, bread each frozen ring by coating in flour, then dredge in egg and lastly in bread crumbs. Transfer to a baking dish.
Carefully lower two coated rings into the oil and fry for about 3 minutes or until golden brown. Continue this until all of the rings are fried.
Serve warm with blue cheese, ranch, or more buffalo sauce.
Enjoy!

results.name: Buffalo Chicken Onion Rings

components.raw_text: 1 1-ounce packet of dry ranch dressing mix

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C).
Remove excess moisture from chicken wings with a paper towel.
In a large bowl, stir in baking powder and salt until chicken is thoroughly coated.

Bake on a baking rack for 1 hour, or until golden brown and crispy, flipping every 20 minutes. (For best results, place baking rack on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper or foil to catch drippings).
In a skillet, combine buffalo sauce ingredients on medium heat.
Then stir in chicken wings until fully coated.
Serve with your favorite side dish or dipping sauce.
Enjoy!

Take your pick from spicy Sweet Soya Chicken Wings or Instagram-ready Nashville Style Hot Wings. So, pick your favorite and let's get cookin'!

instructions.display_text: Combine all ingredients in a crockpot.
Cook on high for 4 hours or low for 8 hours.
Remove chicken and shred, then return to the crockpot for 10 minutes.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: Foods From Scooby Doo Every 90s Kid Will Love
compilations.description: Scoooooooby-Dooby Doo! Wow, it's been a long time since we've said THAT, hasn't it? But we haven't forgotten our Scooby snacks. Get ready for a Scooby Doo marathon with some of our recipes that Shaggy would approve of. Whether it's an extra cheesy pizza margharita, a 4-flavor sandwich ring, or the chewiest of chocolate cookies, we got your Scooby-inspired snacks figured out.

Are you team Chicken or Turkey? Can't decide? Well, who said you can't have them both? These mouth-watering recipes strike the perfect balance. Add a chicken touch to your lunch menu with our Slow Cooker Buffalo Chicken Chili. Then, for dinner, try a Thanksgiving-worthy Turkey Roulade. Bring on the birds!
compilations.name: Chicken Vs Turkey

compilations.description: As fun as it sounds, cooking a big family dinner can be a chaotic task. Here’s a list of recipes that can make it much easier. Just add tomato sauce to take any dish to the next level. Keep it simple with Penne with Tomato Sauce, or make a pot of The Ultimate Tomato Sauce, then use the tangy, delicious sauce to make Mozzarella-Stuffed Turkey Meatloaf. Let's gear up for a cozy night in!
compilations.name: Tasty Tomato Sauce Recipes!
